english: Old Lucky (epithet); venerable and auspicious; respectful nickname element; luck‑invoking branding

etymology.description: 老 + 吉 = respectful “old” + “auspicious” → “Old Lucky”; venerable, luck-invoking epithet/brand element.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the respectful prefix 老 with the auspicious morpheme 吉 to create a warm, luck‑invoking epithet or brand name. Common in nicknames or product names to signal venerability and good fortune.

examples.chinese: 大家都叫他老吉(大家都叫他老吉)，觉得这个外号很吉利(覺得這個外號很吉利)。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā dōu jiào tā Lǎo Jí, juéde zhège wàihào hěn jílì.
examples.english: Everyone calls him “Old Lucky,” finding the nickname auspicious.

examples.chinese: 这款饮料叫“老吉”(這款飲料叫「老吉」)，名字听起来亲切又讨喜(名字聽起來親切又討喜)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kuǎn yǐnliào jiào “Lǎo Jí”, míngzi tīng qǐlái qīnqiè yòu tǎoxǐ.
examples.english: This beverage is called “Laoji,” a name that sounds friendly and likable.

examples.chinese: 在北方方言里，“老”常用作尊称(在北方法言裡，「老」常用作尊稱)，所以“老吉”带有敬意和祝福(所以「老吉」帶有敬意和祝福)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Běifāng fāngyán lǐ, “lǎo” cháng yòngzuò zūnchēng, suǒyǐ “Lǎo Jí” dàiyǒu jìngyì hé zhùfú.
examples.english: In northern dialects, “lao” is often a respectful prefix, so “Laoji” carries respect and blessings.
